rComments: Professor Bernard is very passionate. However, English is her second language and sometimes she has difficulty expressing her ideas clearly. The course also focused too heavily on postcolonial African politics rather than specific African political theories. It was inappropriate for the course. She's a very easy marker. My lowest mark was a 93.

Professor is supposed to be lecturing on Non-Western Political Thought, but treating it as a platform for a weak, convoluted, and repetitive historical overview of post-colonial Africa.  Way too big a topic for one course, and NOT WHAT WAS SUPPOSED TO BE TAUGHT.  Feedback is unclear. Marking is unpredictable.  Lectures are poorly organized.

The class African Political Thought is interesting and unique, but quite difficult to understand because of a lot of new information. Professor Isabelle Bernard is young and nice to students. She's inspirational and I would definitively take another class with her.
